speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: SCENE III. A council-chamber.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: The DUKE and Senators sitting at a table; Officers attending

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: There is no composition in these news

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: That gives them credit.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Indeed, they are disproportion'd;

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: My letters say a hundred and seven galleys.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: And mine, a hundred and forty.

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: And mine, two hundred:

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: But though they jump not on a just account,--

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: As in these cases, where the aim reports,

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: 'Tis oft with difference--yet do they all confirm

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: A Turkish fleet, and bearing up to Cyprus.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Nay, it is possible enough to judgment:

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: I do not so secure me in the error,

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: But the main article I do approve

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: In fearful sense.

speaker: Sailor
text_entry: [Within]  What, ho! what, ho! what, ho!

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: A messenger from the galleys.

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: Enter a Sailor

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Now, what's the business?

speaker: Sailor
text_entry: The Turkish preparation makes for Rhodes;

speaker: Sailor
text_entry: So was I bid report here to the state

speaker: Sailor
text_entry: By Signior Angelo.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: How say you by this change?

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: This cannot be,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: By no assay of reason: 'tis a pageant,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: To keep us in false gaze. When we consider

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: The importancy of Cyprus to the Turk,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: And let ourselves again but understand,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: That as it more concerns the Turk than Rhodes,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: So may he with more facile question bear it,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: For that it stands not in such warlike brace,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: But altogether lacks the abilities

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: That Rhodes is dress'd in: if we make thought of this,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: We must not think the Turk is so unskilful

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: To leave that latest which concerns him first,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Neglecting an attempt of ease and gain,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: To wake and wage a danger profitless.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Nay, in all confidence, he's not for Rhodes.

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: Here is more news.

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The Ottomites, reverend and gracious,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Steering with due course towards the isle of Rhodes,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Have there injointed them with an after fleet.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Ay, so I thought. How many, as you guess?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Of thirty sail: and now they do restem

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Their backward course, bearing with frank appearance

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Their purposes toward Cyprus. Signior Montano,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Your trusty and most valiant servitor,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: With his free duty recommends you thus,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And prays you to believe him.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: 'Tis certain, then, for Cyprus.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Marcus Luccicos, is not he in town?

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: He's now in Florence.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Write from us to him; post-post-haste dispatch.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Here comes Brabantio and the valiant Moor.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Enter BRABANTIO, OTHELLO, IAGO, RODERIGO, and Officers

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Valiant Othello, we must straight employ you

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Against the general enemy Ottoman.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: To BRABANTIO

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: I did not see you; welcome, gentle signior;

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: We lack'd your counsel and your help tonight.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: So did I yours. Good your grace, pardon me;

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Neither my place nor aught I heard of business

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Hath raised me from my bed, nor doth the general care

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Take hold on me, for my particular grief

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Is of so flood-gate and o'erbearing nature

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: That it engluts and swallows other sorrows

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: And it is still itself.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Why, what's the matter?

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: My daughter! O, my daughter!

speaker: Senator
text_entry: Dead?

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Ay, to me;

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: She is abused, stol'n from me, and corrupted

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: By spells and medicines bought of mountebanks;

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: For nature so preposterously to err,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Being not deficient, blind, or lame of sense,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Sans witchcraft could not.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Whoe'er he be that in this foul proceeding

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Hath thus beguiled your daughter of herself

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: And you of her, the bloody book of law

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: You shall yourself read in the bitter letter

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: After your own sense, yea, though our proper son

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Stood in your action.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Humbly I thank your grace.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Here is the man, this Moor, whom now, it seems,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Your special mandate for the state-affairs

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Hath hither brought.

speaker: Senator
text_entry: We are very sorry for't.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: [To OTHELLO]  What, in your own part, can you say to this?

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Nothing, but this is so.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Most potent, grave, and reverend signiors,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My very noble and approved good masters,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That I have ta'en away this old man's daughter,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It is most true; true, I have married her:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The very head and front of my offending

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Hath this extent, no more. Rude am I in my speech,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And little bless'd with the soft phrase of peace:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For since these arms of mine had seven years' pith,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Till now some nine moons wasted, they have used

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Their dearest action in the tented field,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And little of this great world can I speak,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: More than pertains to feats of broil and battle,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And therefore little shall I grace my cause

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: In speaking for myself. Yet, by your gracious patience,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I will a round unvarnish'd tale deliver

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of my whole course of love; what drugs, what charms,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What conjuration and what mighty magic,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For such proceeding I am charged withal,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I won his daughter.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: A maiden never bold;

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Of spirit so still and quiet, that her motion

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Blush'd at herself; and she, in spite of nature,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Of years, of country, credit, every thing,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: To fall in love with what she fear'd to look on!

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: It is a judgment maim'd and most imperfect

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: That will confess perfection so could err

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Against all rules of nature, and must be driven

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: To find out practises of cunning hell,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Why this should be. I therefore vouch again

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: That with some mixtures powerful o'er the blood,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Or with some dram conjured to this effect,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: He wrought upon her.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: To vouch this, is no proof,

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Without more wider and more overt test

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Than these thin habits and poor likelihoods

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Of modern seeming do prefer against him.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: But, Othello, speak:

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Did you by indirect and forced courses

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Subdue and poison this young maid's affections?

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Or came it by request and such fair question

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: As soul to soul affordeth?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I do beseech you,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Send for the lady to the Sagittary,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And let her speak of me before her father:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If you do find me foul in her report,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The trust, the office I do hold of you,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Not only take away, but let your sentence

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Even fall upon my life.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Fetch Desdemona hither.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ancient, conduct them: you best know the place.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exeunt IAGO and Attendants

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And, till she come, as truly as to heaven

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I do confess the vices of my blood,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: So justly to your grave ears I'll present

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: How I did thrive in this fair lady's love,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And she in mine.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Say it, Othello.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Her father loved me; oft invited me;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Still question'd me the story of my life,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: From year to year, the battles, sieges, fortunes,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That I have passed.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I ran it through, even from my boyish days,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To the very moment that he bade me tell it;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Wherein I spake of most disastrous chances,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of moving accidents by flood and field

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of hair-breadth scapes i' the imminent deadly breach,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of being taken by the insolent foe

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And sold to slavery, of my redemption thence

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And portance in my travels' history:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Wherein of antres vast and deserts idle,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Rough quarries, rocks and hills whose heads touch heaven

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It was my hint to speak,--such was the process;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And of the Cannibals that each other eat,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The Anthropophagi and men whose heads

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Do grow beneath their shoulders. This to hear

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Would Desdemona seriously incline:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But still the house-affairs would draw her thence:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Which ever as she could with haste dispatch,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She'ld come again, and with a greedy ear

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Devour up my discourse: which I observing,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Took once a pliant hour, and found good means

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To draw from her a prayer of earnest heart

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That I would all my pilgrimage dilate,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Whereof by parcels she had something heard,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But not intentively: I did consent,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And often did beguile her of her tears,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: When I did speak of some distressful stroke

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That my youth suffer'd. My story being done,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She gave me for my pains a world of sighs:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She swore, in faith, twas strange, 'twas passing strange,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Twas pitiful, 'twas wondrous pitiful:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She wish'd she had not heard it, yet she wish'd

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That heaven had made her such a man: she thank'd me,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And bade me, if I had a friend that loved her,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I should but teach him how to tell my story.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And that would woo her. Upon this hint I spake:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She loved me for the dangers I had pass'd,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And I loved her that she did pity them.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: This only is the witchcraft I have used:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Here comes the lady; let her witness it.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Enter DESDEMONA, IAGO, and Attendants

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: I think this tale would win my daughter too.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Good Brabantio,

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Take up this mangled matter at the best:

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Men do their broken weapons rather use

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Than their bare hands.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: I pray you, hear her speak:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: If she confess that she was half the wooer,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Destruction on my head, if my bad blame

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Light on the man! Come hither, gentle mistress:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Do you perceive in all this noble company

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Where most you owe obedience?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My noble father,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I do perceive here a divided duty:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To you I am bound for life and education;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My life and education both do learn me

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: How to respect you; you are the lord of duty;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I am hitherto your daughter: but here's my husband,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And so much duty as my mother show'd

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To you, preferring you before her father,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: So much I challenge that I may profess

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Due to the Moor my lord.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: God be wi' you! I have done.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Please it your grace, on to the state-affairs:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: I had rather to adopt a child than get it.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Come hither, Moor:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: I here do give thee that with all my heart

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Which, but thou hast already, with all my heart

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: I would keep from thee. For your sake, jewel,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: I am glad at soul I have no other child:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: For thy escape would teach me tyranny,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: To hang clogs on them. I have done, my lord.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Let me speak like yourself, and lay a sentence,

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Which, as a grise or step, may help these lovers

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Into your favour.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: When remedies are past, the griefs are ended

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: By seeing the worst, which late on hopes depended.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: To mourn a mischief that is past and gone

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Is the next way to draw new mischief on.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: What cannot be preserved when fortune takes

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Patience her injury a mockery makes.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: The robb'd that smiles steals something from the thief;

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: He robs himself that spends a bootless grief.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: So let the Turk of Cyprus us beguile;

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: We lose it not, so long as we can smile.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: He bears the sentence well that nothing bears

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: But the free comfort which from thence he hears,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: But he bears both the sentence and the sorrow

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: That, to pay grief, must of poor patience borrow.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: These sentences, to sugar, or to gall,

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Being strong on both sides, are equivocal:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: But words are words; I never yet did hear

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: That the bruised heart was pierced through the ear.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: I humbly beseech you, proceed to the affairs of state.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: The Turk with a most mighty preparation makes for

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Cyprus. Othello, the fortitude of the place is best

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: known to you; and though we have there a substitute

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: of most allowed sufficiency, yet opinion, a

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: sovereign mistress of effects, throws a more safer

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: voice on you: you must therefore be content to

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: slubber the gloss of your new fortunes with this

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: more stubborn and boisterous expedition.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The tyrant custom, most grave senators,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Hath made the flinty and steel couch of war

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My thrice-driven bed of down: I do agnise

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A natural and prompt alacrity

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I find in hardness, and do undertake

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: These present wars against the Ottomites.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Most humbly therefore bending to your state,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I crave fit disposition for my wife.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Due reference of place and exhibition,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: With such accommodation and besort

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: As levels with her breeding.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: If you please,

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Be't at her father's.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: I'll not have it so.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nor I.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Nor I; I would not there reside,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To put my father in impatient thoughts

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: By being in his eye. Most gracious duke,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To my unfolding lend your prosperous ear;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And let me find a charter in your voice,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To assist my simpleness.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: What would You, Desdemona?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: That I did love the Moor to live with him,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My downright violence and storm of fortunes

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: May trumpet to the world: my heart's subdued

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Even to the very quality of my lord:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I saw Othello's visage in his mind,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And to his honour and his valiant parts

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Did I my soul and fortunes consecrate.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: So that, dear lords, if I be left behind,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: A moth of peace, and he go to the war,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: The rites for which I love him are bereft me,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And I a heavy interim shall support

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: By his dear absence. Let me go with him.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let her have your voices.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Vouch with me, heaven, I therefore beg it not,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To please the palate of my appetite,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nor to comply with heat--the young affects

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: In me defunct--and proper satisfaction.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But to be free and bounteous to her mind:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And heaven defend your good souls, that you think

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I will your serious and great business scant

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For she is with me: no, when light-wing'd toys

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of feather'd Cupid seal with wanton dullness

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My speculative and officed instruments,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That my disports corrupt and taint my business,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let housewives make a skillet of my helm,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And all indign and base adversities

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Make head against my estimation!

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Be it as you shall privately determine,

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Either for her stay or going: the affair cries haste,

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: And speed must answer it.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: You must away to-night.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: With all my heart.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: At nine i' the morning here we'll meet again.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Othello, leave some officer behind,

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: And he shall our commission bring to you;

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: With such things else of quality and respect

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: As doth import you.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: So please your grace, my ancient;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A man he is of honest and trust:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To his conveyance I assign my wife,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: With what else needful your good grace shall think

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To be sent after me.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Let it be so.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Good night to every one.

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: To BRABANTIO

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: And, noble signior,

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: If virtue no delighted beauty lack,

speaker: DUKE OF VENICE
text_entry: Your son-in-law is far more fair than black.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Adieu, brave Moor, use Desdemona well.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Look to her, Moor, if thou hast eyes to see:

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: She has deceived her father, and may thee.

speaker: BRABANTIO
text_entry: Exeunt DUKE OF VENICE, Senators, Officers,  and c

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My life upon her faith! Honest Iago,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: My Desdemona must I leave to thee:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I prithee, let thy wife attend on her:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And bring them after in the best advantage.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Come, Desdemona: I have but an hour

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of love, of worldly matters and direction,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To spend with thee: we must obey the time.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exeunt OTHELLO and DESDEMONA

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Iago,--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What say'st thou, noble heart?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: What will I do, thinkest thou?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, go to bed, and sleep.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I will incontinently drown myself.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If thou dost, I shall never love thee after. Why,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: thou silly gentleman!

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: It is silliness to live when to live is torment; and

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: then have we a prescription to die when death is our physician.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O villainous! I have looked upon the world for four

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: times seven years; and since I could distinguish

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: betwixt a benefit and an injury, I never found man

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: that knew how to love himself. Ere I would say, I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: would drown myself for the love of a guinea-hen, I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: would change my humanity with a baboon.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: What should I do? I confess it is my shame to be so

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: fond; but it is not in my virtue to amend it.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Virtue! a fig! 'tis in ourselves that we are thus

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: or thus. Our bodies are our gardens, to the which

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: our wills are gardeners: so that if we will plant

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: nettles, or sow lettuce, set hyssop and weed up

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: thyme, supply it with one gender of herbs, or

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: distract it with many, either to have it sterile

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: with idleness, or manured with industry, why, the

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: power and corrigible authority of this lies in our

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: wills. If the balance of our lives had not one

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: scale of reason to poise another of sensuality, the

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: blood and baseness of our natures would conduct us

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to most preposterous conclusions: but we have

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: reason to cool our raging motions, our carnal

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: stings, our unbitted lusts, whereof I take this that

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: you call love to be a sect or scion.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: It cannot be.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It is merely a lust of the blood and a permission of

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: the will. Come, be a man. Drown thyself! drown

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: cats and blind puppies. I have professed me thy

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: friend and I confess me knit to thy deserving with

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: cables of perdurable toughness; I could never

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: better stead thee than now. Put money in thy

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: purse; follow thou the wars; defeat thy favour with

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: an usurped beard; I say, put money in thy purse. It

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: cannot be that Desdemona should long continue her

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: love to the Moor,-- put money in thy purse,--nor he

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: his to her: it was a violent commencement, and thou

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: shalt see an answerable sequestration:--put but

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: money in thy purse. These Moors are changeable in

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: their wills: fill thy purse with money:--the food

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: that to him now is as luscious as locusts, shall be

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to him shortly as bitter as coloquintida. She must

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: change for youth: when she is sated with his body,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: she will find the error of her choice: she must

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: have change, she must: therefore put money in thy

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: purse. If thou wilt needs damn thyself, do it a

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: more delicate way than drowning. Make all the money

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: thou canst: if sanctimony and a frail vow betwixt

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: an erring barbarian and a supersubtle Venetian not

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: too hard for my wits and all the tribe of hell, thou

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: shalt enjoy her; therefore make money. A pox of

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: drowning thyself! it is clean out of the way: seek

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: thou rather to be hanged in compassing thy joy than

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to be drowned and go without her.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Wilt thou be fast to my hopes, if I depend on

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: the issue?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Thou art sure of me:--go, make money:--I have told

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: thee often, and I re-tell thee again and again, I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: hate the Moor: my cause is hearted; thine hath no

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: less reason. Let us be conjunctive in our revenge

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: against him: if thou canst cuckold him, thou dost

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: thyself a pleasure, me a sport. There are many

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: events in the womb of time which will be delivered.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Traverse! go, provide thy money. We will have more

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: of this to-morrow. Adieu.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Where shall we meet i' the morning?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: At my lodging.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I'll be with thee betimes.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Go to; farewell. Do you hear, Roderigo?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: What say you?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: No more of drowning, do you hear?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I am changed: I'll go sell all my land.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Thus do I ever make my fool my purse:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For I mine own gain'd knowledge should profane,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If I would time expend with such a snipe.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But for my sport and profit. I hate the Moor:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And it is thought abroad, that 'twixt my sheets

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He has done my office: I know not if't be true;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But I, for mere suspicion in that kind,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Will do as if for surety. He holds me well;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The better shall my purpose work on him.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Cassio's a proper man: let me see now:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To get his place and to plume up my will

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: In double knavery--How, how? Let's see:--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: After some time, to abuse Othello's ear

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That he is too familiar with his wife.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He hath a person and a smooth dispose

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To be suspected, framed to make women false.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The Moor is of a free and open nature,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That thinks men honest that but seem to be so,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And will as tenderly be led by the nose

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As asses are.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I have't. It is engender'd. Hell and night

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Must bring this monstrous birth to the world's light.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit
